Comment:
Hi everyone!

Picture the scene - you are in a single piece ending, you have a bishop, your opponent has a knight.  You are a pawn up.  Then the game ends in a draw and for me a low draw at that.  You wonder - how did it all go wrong.  Well here goes.  After facing many Sicilians I now get a Petrov.  This is when black plays 2...... Nf6 instead of Nc6.

37. h4.  I felt that if I took on g4 then black would take with the f pawn and not the h pawn.  I did not want to risk black getting a passer on the h file.  This becomes the first stage of the gridlock process however.
